text: quick question from the `cms-theme-boilerplate`  <http://STYLEGUIDE.md|STYLEGUIDE.md> :<https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/blob/master/STYLEGUIDE.md#fieldsjson>

the link seen  in this line: "This is in preparation for <https://git.hubteam.com/HubSpot/themes-and-modules/issues/263|this update>. " requires a github teams login. Is that link supposed to point to a publicly visible page?

I'm curious about what the requirement for the `id` value being only defined if it controls other elements impacts as we have been self-defining IDs as to avoid running into conflicts between our developer sandboxes as dynamically generated IDs tend to ram into each other.

Sorry, no that link should not have been posted.
You do not need to set ID’s.

I see we currently have a hole in the docs at the moment regarding visibility controls I will get that updated and send you a link showing how to do it now.

In the short term you can use the Design Manager UI to add the visibility controls(remember to fetch, so you have those settings locally too).

So this raises an interesting point regarding DM usage. We are truly trying to avoid fetching for any new builds as the dynamically generated IDs create a unique pain point while working with multiple developers in multiple sandboxes and then sending everything through Github and using that as our base.
Oodles of conflicts when merging files
to add clarification, you do not *need* to add ids manually. You CAN specify your own and that is fine to do.
word.
And how vital is the ordering of the params in these JSON files?
Fully understand, this is purely a documentation issue. The short term recommendation above is just to help you move forward and use visibility controls before we’ve got it thoroughly documented.
fo sho
thanks!

While I have your focus, are the icons here: <https://canvas.HubSpot.com/styles/icons> open for us to use when setting up custom modules on our end? If so, what is the magical URL or snippet to integrate them into the `"icon"` param in the meta.json?
:smile: I might have been digging into all of this this morning

It is not vital. We use it for the HubSpot themes as more of a readability piece. I'm making some updates to the style guide now. The style guide is more for the boilerplate specific project but feel free to take bits and pieces that you find beneficial from it for your own projects.
sweet. thanks for the info <@U26AKMZ19>
hey <@U26AKMZ19> -- Do you have any info on the usage of the HubSpot Canvas Icons for labeling our custom modules? Are those icons available to use?
<@UDFTHC6PK> I'm not 100% sure. I'm looking into it now though and will let you know once I figure it out.
Sweet! Thanks :slightly_smiling_face:

We don’t currently have an open-source or public version of canvas components that can be used outside of HubSpot. With that being said we are looking at some other ways we could make setting a new module icon easier.
